cellery

Class CellArray2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • cellery.CellArray2D
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CellArrayCylinder, CellArrayMobius

    public class CellArray2D
extends java.lang.Object
    A CellArray is a 2-d array of Cell objects which can kill and revive Cells and retrieve neighborhoods about individual cells.
    Author:
    Zach Tidwell

    • Method Detail

      • initializeCells

        protected static Cell[][] initializeCells(int[][] intArray)
        Initializes a Cell[][] from an integer array. A living Cell is placed in the index corresponding to a value of 1 in the input integer array and dead cells are placed everywhere else.
        Parameters:
        intArray - the input array.
        Returns:
        the array of Cells generated by input array.

      • boundariesOK

        protected static boolean boundariesOK(int ii,
                   int i,
                   int min,
                   int max)

      • getVertical

        public int getVertical(int i,
              int j,
              int r)
        Retrieves the number of living Cells in the vertical neighborhood about the ij-th cell of radius r.
        Parameters:
        i - row index containing the central cell.
        j - column index containing the central cell.
        r - the radius of the neighborhood.
        Returns:
        the number of living cells.

      • toBinaryArray

        public int[][] toBinaryArray()
        Gives an array of binary Values corresponding to the Cells in this. 1 indicates that the Cell is alive and 0 indicates that it is dead.
        Returns:
        the binary array represented the states of Cells in this
